source: 211.org, United Way 2-1-1, Veterans Affairs, Salvation Army, VOA Ohio & Indiana, GLCAP, and county veteran service commissions

resources.name: United Way 2-1-1 Greater Cleveland
resources.address: Serving Cuyahoga, Geauga, and Ross counties
resources.description: 24/7 confidential helpline connecting veterans to community services including housing, food, employment, mental health, and emergency assistance

resources.name: Volunteers of America Ohio & Indiana - Cincinnati
resources.description: CARF accredited veteran housing program providing stable transitional living with case management and support programs

resources.name: Volunteers of America Ohio & Indiana - Cleveland
resources.description: CARF accredited veteran housing program providing stable transitional living with case management and support programs

resources.name: Volunteers of America Ohio & Indiana - Columbus
resources.description: CARF accredited veteran housing with emergency shelter beds for eligible veterans, certified by Ohio Department of Alcohol and Drug Addiction Services

resources.name: Volunteers of America Ohio & Indiana - Dayton
resources.address: 4100 W. Third Street, Building 400, Dayton, OH 45428
resources.description: CARF accredited veteran housing program located on Veterans Affairs Medical Center Campus with integrated VA services

resources.name: Volunteers of America Ohio & Indiana - Sandusky
resources.description: CARF accredited veteran housing program providing stable transitional living environment

resources.name: Great Lakes Community Action Partnership (GLCAP) - Supportive Services for Veteran Families
resources.description: Provides housing assistance to veterans experiencing or at risk of homelessness in 10-county service area. Assists with rental arrearages, first-month rent, security deposits, utility assistance, moving costs, and budgeting

resources.name: Salvation Army Central Ohio - SSVF Program
resources.description: Supportive Services for Veteran Families program serving individual veterans and families experiencing housing crisis. Provides shallow subsidy with up to 2 years of rental assistance to eligible low-income veterans
services: medical and mental health service coordination

resources.name: Veterans Service Commission of Summit County
resources.description: County-mandated service acting as liaison to help veterans navigate VA systems and maximize benefits. Funded by Summit County to serve local veterans

resources.name: Veterans Service Commission of Ashtabula County
resources.description: County government agency providing veteran services and benefits assistance to local veterans

resources.name: Veterans Service Commission of Franklin County
resources.address: 280 E. Broad St., 1st Floor, Columbus, OH 43215
resources.description: County veteran services providing assistance to active and retired military personnel with benefits and support services

resources.name: Veteran Service Commission of Cleveland
resources.description: City-based veteran services providing financial assistance and comprehensive support to Cleveland veterans

resources.name: United States Vets - Toledo
resources.description: Veteran housing organization providing Commons at Garden Lake with 75 apartments for homeless veterans and additional supportive services

resources.name: Veterans Crisis Line
resources.description: Free, confidential crisis support available 24/7 for veterans and their loved ones facing mental health crises, suicidal thoughts, or emotional distress

resources.name: VA Central Ohio Health Care - Mental Health Services
resources.description: VA medical center providing mental health care and suicide prevention services for Ohio veterans with hours 8AM-5PM daily

resources.name: VA Cincinnati Health Care
resources.description: VA medical center serving Cincinnati area veterans with comprehensive health care and mental health services

resources.name: Legal Aid of Southeast and Central Ohio (LASCO)
resources.address: Multiple locations in Southeast and Central Ohio
resources.description: Provides free legal aid to low-income veterans in 36 counties including assistance with military discharge upgrades, housing, family law, and health care access

resources.name: Ohio Legal Help - Veteran Resources Tool
resources.description: Comprehensive tool to find legal assistance organizations and resources for veterans throughout Ohio. Access to six legal aid offices serving the state

resources.name: National Call Center for Homeless Veterans
resources.description: 24/7 national call center helping homeless veterans complete intake applications and connect to local housing and emergency resources

resources.name: Clermont and Brown County Crisis Hotline and Mobile Crisis
resources.description: 24/7 mental health crisis support with mobile crisis team staffed by trained and licensed mental health providers serving veteran and general populations

resources.name: Frontline Services - Cleveland
resources.description: Veterans re-housing and case management services helping homeless veterans transition to stable housing

resources.name: Ohio Department of Veterans Services
resources.description: State agency providing benefits information, county veteran service officer network, and assistance with federal, state, and local veteran benefits
